intro: Xenacanthus zenkerianus, commonly known as the Zenker's xenacanthus, is a rare and ancient plant species native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its unique, spiral-shaped leaves that resemble the structure of certain prehistoric marine organisms. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in dense tropical forests. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, often clustered in compact inflorescences. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Xenacanthus zenkerianus is considered a critically endangered species.
